text:

The University of British Columbia, Canada
September 2023 – June 2024 - Master of Data Science (Domestic/International) Scholarship awarded for academic and leadership achievements. - Current grade: 91% - Capstone Project: Project DrillSense partnered with RioTinto. Created a dashboard to visualize global mining trends and incorporated ML predictive algorithms to identify future drillholes based on commodity, region, and other features.



Universidad de las Américas Puebla, Mexico
June 2020 – December 2021 - Summa Cum Laude, GPA 3.96 - Institutional scholarship granted (60% of tuition covered) - Comprehensive Project: “Consulting and development of a business solution for a beauty products franchise that wants to expand in times of Covid”



Universidad de las Américas Puebla, Mexico
August 2016 – June 2020 - Magna Cum Laude, GPA 3.92 - School of Science Scholar Award for achieving the highest marks in 2019 - Excellence scholarship granted (100% of tuition covered)






DATAKNOW S.A.S., Mexico
August 2022 – August 2023 - Databases clustered to fight against money laundering and financing of terrorism as the law required it for various Grupo Bancolombia bank entities. - Python Scripts developed ensuring reproducibility when used with future data.



INDRA MINSAIT BUSINESS CONSULTING, Mexico
February 2022 – July 2022 - Cross Currency Swaps and Bonds’ hedging strategies identified, reconciliated between the bank’s storage systems and corrected. - Accounting entries cleaned and Roll Over reports automated on VBA following IFRS9 standards. Output folder established as a source for Salesforce and Murex to retrieve results. - Accounting rules in Murex homologated and updated in accordance with the new accounting structure of the bank.



Mexican Railways National Museum, Mexico
June 2019 – March 2020 - Museum statistics surveys for the National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI) carried out and data analyzed. - VBA Userforms developed to automate survey data capture and uploading process to INEGI’s platform. - R script developed to periodically provide a standardized report with graphs and figures of the information contained in the Excel sheets.

title: About me
text:
My name is Marco Polo Bravo Montiel (the first two names are considered to be my “first name”, while the last two are considered to be my “last name”) and I’m 26 years old. I come from Puebla, a beautiful city located in the center of Mexico, my beloved homeland. I graduated from Universidad de las Américas Puebla (UDLAP), presumably, the best Mexican university (please don’t tell Alexi, haha). I did my undergrad in Actuarial Sciences and I have currently passed 3 SOA exams (P, FM and IFM). I also hold a Master’s Degree in Corporate Finance from that same university. I’ve worked for over 7 years as State Co-Delegate for the Mexican Mathematical Olympiad. In the last two years I’ve worked as a Data Analyst/Junior Data Scientist, and I’ve been professor at UDLAP.
I don’t know if other MDS students will actually visit this website in the coming days. However, this will definitely be read by a TA. Thank you for your hard work!
